panels.message: Freedom to destroy what has worth

panels.implication: Freedom needs something to push against

panels.teaching: Freedom makes sense only in context

dialogue.text: Freedom, on the other hand, has a weird relationship with meaning. It's only valuable because it can be constrained. Freedom is contextual. It's only visible against the backdrop of limits.

psychological_notes: The architect demonstrates freedom's paradox through destruction of value. Burning money shows that freedom means the ability to act against constraint, but without the constraint (money's value), the act becomes meaningless. This profound insight reveals that absolute freedom would be indistinguishable from chaos.
philosophical_underpinning: Freedom exists only in relationship to limitation
therapeutic_direction: Understanding that constraints enable rather than prevent meaningful choice
